description: From Ancient Greek φαντασιάζομαι (phantasiázomai, “to be presented to the mind”).

verbs.description: fantasize (third-person singular simple present fantasizes, present participle fantasizing, simple past and past participle fantasized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To indulge in fantasy; to imagine things only possible in fantasy.
examples: I fantasized about my ideal date.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To portray in the mind, using fantasy.
examples: Actress Dana Delany fantasizes about making love with two men.
